",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":""He was tired of the stinking bureaucracy that seemed to hinder every progress he tried to make.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"Marshland (literal)"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":""We had to carefully navigate through the marshland to reach the other side of the park.""}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":""The marshland was teeming with birdlife, making it a paradise for ornithologists.""}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"These examples show that while the original sentence uses the phrase literally and descriptively, each component of the phrase can be used to convey different meanings or scenarios."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":[" Recovering Strength? ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"Pay no heed"}}," to that, young hobbit. "]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The phrase "pay no heed" means to ignore or not pay attention to something. In the given sentence, it suggests that the young hobbit should not be concerned or worried about "Recovering Strength.""}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are some example sentences to illustrate other uses of the phrase "pay no heed":"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The children played noisily in the hallway, but their father paid no heed to the commotion as he was deeply engrossed in his book."}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Here, "pay no heed" means the father ignored the noise made by the children."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"The weather forecast warned of rain, but the hikers paid no heed and went ahead with their plans."}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"In this case, "pay no heed" means the hikers disregarded the weather warning."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"Despite the rumors circulating about the company, the confident CEO paid no heed and focused on executing her strategy."}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"This use implies that the CEO chose to ignore the rumors."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"These examples show that "pay no heed" is used to describe the act of consciously ignoring or not being influenced by something."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":[" I ask only for the strength to defend my people. If you would but lend me the Ring. Why do you ",{"type":"b","key":null,"props":{"children":"recoil"}},", I am no thief. "]}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":["In this context, the word ",{"type":"strong","key":"1","props":{"children":""recoil""}}," refers to someone physically pulling back or drawing away in response to something shocking, unpleasant, or frightening. It describes an involuntary backward motion prompted by surprise or disgust."]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"Here are example sentences demonstrating other meanings or uses of "recoil":"}},"
",{"type":"ol","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To move back suddenly in fear or disgust:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The cat recoiled when the child tried to pet it too quickly."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"3","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To spring back during or after an impact or compression:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"The rifle recoiled after it was fired, causing the hunter to adjust his stance."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"5","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To shrink mentally or physically as a reaction:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"She recoiled at the thought of having to give a speech in front of a large audience."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"li","key":"7","props":{"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":{"type":"strong","key":null,"props":{"children":"To feel strong hesitation or repulsion towards something:"}}}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"2","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"He recoiled from the plan, feeling it was too risky to execute."}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"Each use of the term "recoil" involves a form of retreat or withdrawal, whether physical or emotional."}},"
"]}}]}}}}]}}
